newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Cimpor rises on BFE price hopes.
newsitem.headline: Cimpor rises on BFE price hopes.

text.p: Shares in Portuguese cement group Cimpor rose on Lisbon bourse amid hopes that the privatisation price of Banco de Fomento e Exterior (BFE), in which Cimpor has a stake, could be above expectations, dealers said.
"The rise in Cimpor is based on the expected privatisation price," said one dealer. "With expectations for the BFE share price now running at more than 2,500 escudos, this is good news for Cimpor."
Shares in Cimpor-Cimentos de Portugal, which has an 11.06 percent stake in BFE, stood at 3,405 escudos, up 15, in volume of 177,171 shares on Lisbon bourse at 1205 GMT.
Trade in BFE shares was suspended in Lisbon on Thursday after the Finance Ministry called a news conference about its privatisation.
The Finance Ministry may announce at the conference, set for 1300 GMT, which of three competing Portuguese financial groups will be awarded the state's 65 percent stake.
However, it was not certain that a clear-cut winner would have yet emerged from the complex bidding process.
BFE shares were suspended on the Lisbon bourse by the Financial Markets Committee at 2,545 escudos ($16.7) which would value the state stake at around 130 billion escudos ($850 million).

The ministry should announce the results of a report by a special jury set up to evaluate bids by rivals Banco Portugues de Investimento (BPI), Portugal's fifth largest bank, Banco Finantia and Banco Nacional de Credito Imobiliario (BNC).
Banco Finantia is allied to Swiss Bank Corp in the bid while BNC is controlled by cork magnate Americo Amorim.
